column2: You've heard from courtiers the ways of cheating. Sounds fun, but let's not go too far.
You've discovered more of the ways of cheating.
You've ascended to the ways of cheating.
Your distant decendants will mark you as their founding ancestor.
Using my cheatery, I can conjure up some gold.
Using my cheatery, I can conjure up some prestige.
Using my cheatery, I can conjure up some piety.
Using my cheatery, I can conjure up some technology.
Using my extensive influence and power, I can convince local populaces to convert to the one and true faith.
Using my extensive influence and power, I can convince local populaces to assimilate into my culture.
Using my extensive influence and power, I can convince local populaces to be more like me.
After you conquer those provinces, you get those pesky modifiers on administration. Remove them.
Using my extensive influence and power, I can convince my landed vassals to repeal ownership of their lands.
Using my extensive influence and power, I can raise my religious authority to it's highest level.

After accumulating a mass of gold and prestige, you decide that cheating would be the best. Right? I mean, you've already done it with the weaker version, why not become the full potential of your powers?
Using my special administration, I can upgrade from this petty form of cheating to a greater, better form.
You said what about my mum?
Do not tell me what is impossible.
My god better than your god.
My culture is better than your culture.
Give your Patronage and Support to this promising person
Revoke your Patronage and Support from this useless thing
I don't want to know anymore.
Let me make all the important decisions.
We need them at their best.
Force this individual to join your court.
Allows [Root.GetFullName] to build with extraordinary speed.
Makes [Root.GetFullName] a genius when it comes to plotting.
Greatly enhances the reinforcement speed for the armies of [Root.GetFullName].
Normalizes the reinforcement speed for the armies of [Root.GetFullName].
Remove all claims against titles held or controlled by [From.GetFullName].
Remove all claims against titles held or controlled by [From.GetFullName].
Build and upgrade a hospital in this province.
Upgrade the fort in this province.
Build and upgrade a trade post in this province.
Invite a local from these lands who belongs to [Root.Location.Culture.GetName] culture and follows [Root.Location.Religion.GetName] religion.
column6: Invitar a un lugareño de estas tierras que se identifique con la cultura [Root.Location.Culture.GetName] y siga la religión [Root.Location.Religion.GetName].

column2: Upgrades the family palace for your patrician family.
Destroy the hospital in this province.
Destroy the fort in this province.
Destroy the trade post in this province.
Upgrade this holding with all supported buildings.
Vote which Titles Split between Direct Decendents
Six Elders decide the course of rulership
I feel strength in me. I have not grown old. I count the days of my birth, but it does not matter.

As you were in your court reigning, a rather shifty and dirty man holding a vial of cyan blue elixir approaches your throne. You believe the man to be a peasant, although from the clothe of him he might be a chemist. A madman at that. He squabbles on and on to you about the magical powers of the elixir, nearly dropping it thrice. He says the potion can give you an endless life.... but also could end it. He offers it for a price, but it seems relatively generous for such a big chance. You are hesitant of choice, but it could be benefiting.
It could kill me? Are you insane!?
Send a warning and burn the witch!
Other decisions will take this modification into account.
Other decisions will ignore this modification.

They say cheaters never prosper, right? Show them otherwise with these buildings.
This character, much more vexatious than their Lesser counterparts, is the result of vexatious cheating, and undeniably a cheater.
This character is the result of vexatious cheating. Practically indestructible.
This character, although not as vexatious as their Greater counterparts, is still a cheater.
This character is a descendant of House [GetOnlyDynastyName].
Grant divine blood trait to all of their direct descendants.

Members of this dynasty are forever loyal to the Crown, or in other words they are - Pia Fidelis, Latin feminine form for "pious and faithful", was the cognomen of several Roman legions, awarded by an emperor when the legion had proved "devoted and loyal". Some legions received this honour several times, and their name included the number of awards.

This dynasty is one of the new nobility, parvenu! They are less respected than old ones like Capetings, Welfs etc. This character is a descendant of a humble background who has rapidly gained wealth or an influential social position; a nouveau riche; an upstart, a social climber.

This dynasty is one of the new nobility, parvenu! They are less respected than old ones like Capetings, Welfs etc. This character is a descendant of a humble background who has rapidly gained wealth or an influential social position; a nouveau riche; an upstart, a social climber.

This character is a member of a new noble family of noble origin. He is a descendant of a humble background who has rapidly gained wealth or an influential social position; a nouveau riche; an upstart, a social climber.
This character is of royal blood. He is a direct male descendant of a King or Emperor and counts as a great noble.
